alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Ohio; Switzerland (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 08 at 6:16PM EDT until June 08 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR OHIO...SOUTHEASTERN DEARBORN...NORTHEASTERN SWITZERLAND...KENTON AND BOONE COUNTIES... At 615 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Oakbrook, moving east at 40 mph. 69 mph winds observed at Cincinnati Northern Kentucky International airport. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Covington, Florence, Independence, Erlanger, Edgewood, Elsmere, Fort Mitchell, Villa Hills, Taylor Mill, Fort Wright, Lawrenceburg, Crescent Springs, Aurora, Walton, Crestview Hills, Park Hills, Lakeside Park, Rising Sun, Oakbrook and Burlington. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 74 and 77. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 169 and 189. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana...and northern Kentucky. A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure, such as a basement or small interior room. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
